com.avaya.ic.sdk

Interface WorkItem


  • public interface WorkItem
    The WorkItem represents an unit of work that is assigned to an IC user.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  WorkItem.CallType 
      static class  WorkItem.CollaborationIntent
      Defines different intents to use in collaboration methods.
      static class  WorkItem.ContactAttributesChanged
      Indicates whether any data has changed.
      static class  WorkItem.CurrentContextChanged
      Indicates whether the current context has changed.
      static class  WorkItem.Operation 
      static class  WorkItem.OperationFailed
      Indicates that the asynchronous operation failed.
      static class  WorkItem.OperationSucceeded
      Indicates that the asynchronous operation has succeeded.
      static class  WorkItem.RequestCustomerHistoryResponse
      Indicates that the response to the customer history request has arrived.
      static class  WorkItem.RequestHistoryResponse
      Indicates that the response to the WorkItem history request has arrived.
      static class  WorkItem.RONA
      Indicates that the RONA timer was reached, because the agent did not accept the WorkItem within the limit set in the RONA timeout setting.
      static class  WorkItem.State
      Defines various states of a WorkItem.
      static class  WorkItem.StateChanged
      Indicates whether the state has changed.
      static class  WorkItem.TerminateReason
      Defines the various terminate reasons applicable to a WorkItem.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void accept()
      Accepts the WorkItem.
      void associateCall(WorkItem.CallType callType, CallOptions callOptions)
      Allows to place a new call and associate it with this workitem.
      void collaborationBegin(WorkItem.CollaborationIntent intent, MediaInteraction mediaInteraction, java.lang.String destination, AddressBook.DestinationType destinationType, java.lang.String collaborationComment)
      Initiates a conference or consult with the destination.
      void collaborationCancel()
      Cancels the collaboration request.
      void collaborationComplete()
      Completes the collaboration so the target agent is now part of the collaboration.
      void complete()
      Completes the WorkItem.
      void decline()
      Declines the WorkItem.
      Note: Decline is not allowed on voice calls and will throw OperationFailed exception.

      IC Properties that affect this API:
      Agent/Desktop/Chat/AllowDecline, Agent/Desktop/Email/AllowDecline
      void defer()
      Defers the WorkItem.
      java.lang.String getCollaborationComment()
      Get The comment that was inserted on the WorkItem to help a user understand the context of a collaboration.

      Get Attributes of the EDU container for the WorkItem.

      Get The date when the WorkItem was created.

      Get A history of the interaction between a specific customer and IC.

      Get The phone number or email address or chat user identifier for the customer.

      Get A key that represents the customer record in the IC database.

      Get The date that the WorkItem was delivered

      Get A list of Documents that the WorkItem contains.

      Get A history of how a specific WorkItem traversed through the IC system.

      Get The unique id associated with a WorkItem.

      Get A list of the MediaInteractions that the WorkItem contains.

      Get The login id of the agent who is currently owning this workitem.

      Get The total time that the WorkItem was in an IC queue.

      Get The current state of the WorkItem.

      Performs blind transfer of the WorkItem to the specified destination.
      void transferCancel()
      Cancels the transfer request for Chat workitem.

      This API is specfically designed for cancelling the transfer request for Chat workitems.

      • getTopic

        java.lang.String getTopic()
        Get The topic of media associated. This value can also be set from EDU field "workitem.topic" which can be populated, using workflows, prior to workitem delivery in qualify flows. OOTB this will return the topic of media
        Returns:
        The topic of media associated. This value can also be set from EDU field "workitem.topic" which can be populated, using workflows, prior to workitem delivery in qualify flows. OOTB this will return the topic of media

      • getDeliveredDate

        java.util.Date getDeliveredDate()
        Get The date that the WorkItem was delivered
        Returns:
        The date that the WorkItem was delivered

      • getQueueTime

        long getQueueTime()
        Get The total time that the WorkItem was in an IC queue. This total includes the time in queue before the WorkItem was assigned to an agent and the time in queue between transfers from one agent to another.
        Returns:
        The total time that the WorkItem was in an IC queue. This total includes the time in queue before the WorkItem was assigned to an agent and the time in queue between transfers from one agent to another.

      • getContactAttributes

        NameValueList getContactAttributes()
        Get Attributes of the EDU container for the WorkItem. Attribute names are pre-defined, and loaded during the assignment of the WorkItem.
        Returns:
        Attributes of the EDU container for the WorkItem. Attribute names are pre-defined, and loaded during the assignment of the WorkItem.

        Parameters:

      • getTerminateReason

        WorkItem.TerminateReason getTerminateReason()
        Get The reason that the WorkItem was terminated. The default value of TerminateReason is NORMAL. The value of TerminateReason may change when the WorkItem moves into the WRAPUP state. Checking TerminateReason is only meaningful when the WorkItem state is WRAPUP.
        Returns:
        The reason that the WorkItem was terminated. The default value of TerminateReason is NORMAL. The value of TerminateReason may change when the WorkItem moves into the WRAPUP state. Checking TerminateReason is only meaningful when the WorkItem state is WRAPUP.

      • isWorkitemSupervised

        boolean isWorkitemSupervised()
        Get This helps to decide whether the workitem is supervised workitem or not. Only applicable if logged in user is supervisor. In normal user case, this will always be false.
        Returns:
        This helps to decide whether the workitem is supervised workitem or not. Only applicable if logged in user is supervisor. In normal user case, this will always be false.

      • getOwnerLoginId

        java.lang.String getOwnerLoginId()
        Get The login id of the agent who is currently owning this workitem.
        Returns:
        The login id of the agent who is currently owning this workitem.

      • accept

        void accept()
        Accepts the WorkItem.

        IC Properties that affect this API:
        Agent/Desktop/Chat/AutoAccept, Agent/Desktop/Email/AutoAccept, Agent/Desktop/Voice/AutoAcceptACD, Agent/Desktop/Voice/AutoAcceptDirect

      • decline

        void decline()
        Declines the WorkItem.
        Note: Decline is not allowed on voice calls and will throw OperationFailed exception.

        IC Properties that affect this API:
        Agent/Desktop/Chat/AllowDecline, Agent/Desktop/Email/AllowDecline

      • release

        void release()
        Releases the WorkItem.

      • release

        void release(NameValue reasonCode)
        Releases the WorkItem.
        Parameters:
        reasonCode - The reason that the WorkItem was released. This reason must be one of the reasons defined in Session.ReleaseReasonCodes.

      • complete

        void complete()
        Completes the WorkItem.

      • defer

        void defer()
        Defers the WorkItem.

      • makeCurrent

        void makeCurrent()
        Makes the WorkItem current.

      • collaborationBegin

        void collaborationBegin(WorkItem.CollaborationIntent intent,
                        MediaInteraction mediaInteraction,
                        java.lang.String destination,
                        AddressBook.DestinationType destinationType,
                        java.lang.String collaborationComment)
        Initiates a conference or consult with the destination. The destination can be agent, queue, virtual queue, or literal.

        P.S.: While consulting multi-media interaction (Chat and Voice), its advisable to perform consult on child interaction first and then on parent interaction, because if parent is consulted first, it goes in wrapped state thereby not allowing child to complete.

        IC Properties that affect this API:
        Agent/Desktop/Voice/ConferenceEnabled, Agent/Desktop/Voice/ConsultEnabled, Agent/Desktop/Voice/TransferType, Agent/Desktop/VirtualQueueTransferFlowName for virtual queues
        Parameters:
        intent - Intent of the collaboration, for example conference or consult.
        mediaInteraction - The MediaInteraction object to use for collaboration.
        destination - The name or ID of the destination.
        destinationType - The type of destination: agent, queue, virtualqueue, or unknown.
        collaborationComment - The comment associated with the collaboration operation.

      • collaborationCancel

        void collaborationCancel()
        Cancels the collaboration request. P.S.: Canceling a collaboration fails when you have swapped audio and the audio source is PRIMARY. You have to invoke "swapAudio" API again and then cancel the collaboration.

      • collaborationComplete

        void collaborationComplete()
        Completes the collaboration so the target agent is now part of the collaboration.

      • transfer

        void transfer(java.lang.String destination,
              AddressBook.DestinationType destinationType,
              java.lang.String comment)
        Performs blind transfer of the WorkItem to the specified destination.

        IC Properties that affect this API:
        Agent/Desktop/Voice/TransferEnabled, Agent/Desktop/VirtualQueueTransferFlowName for virtual queue transfers
        Parameters:
        destination - The name of the destination.
        destinationType - The type of destination: agent, queue, virtualqueue, or unknown.
        comment - The comment associated with the transfer.

      • transferCancel

        void transferCancel()
        Cancels the transfer request for Chat workitem.

        This API is specfically designed for cancelling the transfer request for Chat workitems. This is done basically because if you transfer a chat to a queue and no one is available in the queue agent will be stuck until someone becomes available in the queue. This API provides flexiblity to cancel the transfer request.

      • setWrapupSelectionList

        void setWrapupSelectionList(WrapupSelectionList wrapupSelectionList)
        Parameters:
        wrapupSelectionList -

      • requestCustomerHistory

        void requestCustomerHistory(CustomerHistory.QueryCriteria criteria)
        Requests a history of the interaction between a specific customer and IC.When the CustomerHistory is received from the server, the Client SDK fires the RequestCustomerHistoryResponse event.

        IC Properties that affect this API:
        Agent/Desktop/CustomerContacts/MaxRecordCount
        Parameters:
        criteria - The enumerated criteria for the database query.

      • requestHistory

        void requestHistory()
        Requests a history of the WorkItem. When the History is received from the server, the Client SDK fires the RequestHistoryResponse event.

      • associateCall

        void associateCall(WorkItem.CallType callType,
                   CallOptions callOptions)
        Allows to place a new call and associate it with this workitem. Currently only voice call can be associated with chat call, in case of Chat and Callback or Chat And Voip. Invoking this API will link chat edu and voice edu together and "hubedu" edu attribute field will be set.
        Parameters:
        callType - The constant to specify the type of call being placed.
        callOptions - The enumerated options for the call being placed.

      • isOperationAllowed

        boolean isOperationAllowed(java.lang.String operationName)
        Parameters:
        operationName - This function is used to determine if a certain operation is allowed on the current workitem.
        Usage e.g isOperationAllowed("COLLABORATIONCOMPLETE"). Allowed values for operation are:
        ACCEPT, DECLINE, RELEASE, COMPLETE, DEFER, MAKECURRENT, COLLABORATIONBEGIN, COLLABORATIONCANCEL, COLLABORATIONCOMPLETE , TRANSFER, TRANSFERCANCEL, SETWRAPUPSELECTIONLIST, REQUESTCUSTOMERHISTORY, REQUESTHISTORY, ASSOCIATECALL
        In case of an unrecognised 'operation type', the function returns false.
        Returns:
